ourTeamSection.title: CollAction is a truly international Team
ourTeamSection.description: We collaborate with volunteers from all over the world, spanning 5 continents and more than 15 countries. Our native app, website and content management system are open source, such that everyone can benefit from it. Below you see the engineers building our digital infrastructure and the ambassadors bringing it into practice!

joinTeamSection.title: Join the Team
joinTeamSection.description: Are you dedicated, independent, proactive and eager to join us? Send us your resum√© and motivation letter and we'll get in touch.

vacancy1.title: Engineer
vacancy1.description: You're an experiened (senior) developer or engineer that excels at personal projects and/or studies. You've successfully built multiple applications from start to end and know how to get things done. You have professional experience, but you want more besides your regular job. You want to broaden your scope, learn new things or work in an international environment. Together with a team of like minded individuals, you'll be building the digital infrastructure of CollAction.

vacancy2.title: Head of Marketing
vacancy2.description: You're an experienced marketeer, either from studies or personal projects, that knows how to set up campaigns, write content and use social media effectively. You're entrepreneurial, full of initiative and have a feeling for the intersection between social entrepreneurship and the green community. You can set up a marketing plan from start to end and execute it.

vacancy3.title: Product Designer
vacancy3.description: You're shaping the CollAction brand by improving the UX/UI of our native application, web and more. You need not be a designer (yet). What matters is that you are willing to learn the ins and outs of product design and that you are interested in building beautiful, on-brand digital experiences.

vacancy4.title: Project Manager
vacancy4.description: You are the core of a project. You can shape, scale and carry a project from start to end. You communicate with all relevant parties, such as the client, newspapers and local organisations. You find ways to do things that seem impossible at the start. You take responsibility and will do everything in your power to make the project a success.
